p: Since the early twentieth century, the detection of viruses in clinical samples via molecular methods has become widespread. Diagnosis of viruses can be done directly using clinical samples and cell culture supernatants via specific nucleic acid probes, which can find their complementary target viral RNA or DNA sequences or by using NAATs [ 42]. Also, purification and separation of nucleic acids from antibodies is easy, which is not always the case for viral antigens, whose detection may be inhibited by antigen/antibody complexes [ 43].
